00006 void
00007 SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::ctor(const PESectionTableEntry_disk *disk)
00008 {
00009     char name[9];
00010     strncpy(name, disk->name, 8);
00011     name[8] = '\0';
00012     this->set_name( name );
00013 
00014     /* Decode file format */
00015     p_virtual_size     = le_to_host(disk->virtual_size);
00016     p_rva              = le_to_host(disk->rva);
00017     p_physical_size    = le_to_host(disk->physical_size);
00018     p_physical_offset  = le_to_host(disk->physical_offset);
00019     p_coff_line_nums   = le_to_host(disk->coff_line_nums);
00020     p_n_relocs         = le_to_host(disk->n_relocs);
00021     p_n_coff_line_nums = le_to_host(disk->n_coff_line_nums);
00022     p_flags            = le_to_host(disk->flags);
00023 }

00026 void
00027 SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::update_from_section(SgAsmPESection *section)
00028 {
00029     SgAsmPEFileHeader *fhdr = SageInterface::getEnclosingNode<SgAsmPEFileHeader>(section);
00030     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr!=NULL);
00031 
00032     p_virtual_size = section->get_mapped_size();
00033     p_rva = section->get_mapped_preferred_rva();
00034     p_physical_size = section->get_size();
00035     p_physical_offset = section->get_offset();
00036     p_name = section->get_name()->get_string();
00037 
00038     /* Mapping permissions */
00039     if (section->get_mapped_rperm()) {
00040         p_flags |= SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_READABLE;
00041     } else {
00042         p_flags &= ~SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_READABLE;
00043     }
00044     if (section->get_mapped_wperm()) {
00045         p_flags |= SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_WRITABLE;
00046     } else {
00047         p_flags &= ~SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_WRITABLE;
00048     }
00049     if (section->get_mapped_xperm()) {
00050         p_flags |= SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_EXECUTABLE;
00051     } else {
00052         p_flags &= ~SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_EXECUTABLE;
00053     }
00054 
00055     /* Mapping alignment */
00056     if (section->is_mapped() && section->get_mapped_alignment()!=fhdr->get_e_section_align()) {
00057         switch (section->get_mapped_alignment()) {
00058             case 0:
00059             case 1:
00060                 p_flags &= ~SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_MASK;
00061                 p_flags |=  SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_1;
00062                 break;
00063             case 2:
00064                 p_flags &= ~SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_MASK;
00065                 p_flags |=  SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_2;
00066                 break;
00067             case 4:
00068                 p_flags &= ~SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_MASK;
00069                 p_flags |=  SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_4;
00070                 break;
00071             case 8:
00072                 p_flags &= ~SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_MASK;
00073                 p_flags |=  SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_8;
00074                 break;
00075             case 16:
00076                 p_flags &= ~SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_MASK;
00077                 p_flags |=  SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_16;
00078                 break;
00079             case 32:
00080                 p_flags &= ~SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_MASK;
00081                 p_flags |=  SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_32;
00082                 break;
00083             case 64:
00084                 p_flags &= ~SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_MASK;
00085                 p_flags |=  SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_64;
00086                 break;
00087             case 128:
00088                 p_flags &= ~SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_MASK;
00089                 p_flags |=  SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_128;
00090                 break;
00091             case 256:
00092                 p_flags &= ~SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_MASK;
00093                 p_flags |=  SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_256;
00094                 break;
00095             case 512:
00096                 p_flags &= ~SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_MASK;
00097                 p_flags |=  SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_512;
00098                 break;
00099             case 1024:
00100                 p_flags &= ~SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_MASK;
00101                 p_flags |=  SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_1k;
00102                 break;
00103             case 2048:
00104                 p_flags &= ~SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_MASK;
00105                 p_flags |=  SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_2k;
00106                 break;
00107             case 4096:
00108                 p_flags &= ~SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_MASK;
00109                 p_flags |=  SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_4k;
00110                 break;
00111             case 8192:
00112                 p_flags &= ~SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_MASK;
00113                 p_flags |=  SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::OF_ALIGN_8k;
00114                 break;
00115             default:
00116                 break; /* leave as is */
00117         }
00118     }
00119 
00120 #if 0 /*FIXME*/
00121     p_coff_line_nums = 0;
00122     p_n_relocs = 0;
00123     p_n_coff_line_nums = 0;
00124 #endif
00125 }

00127 /* Encodes a section table entry back into disk format. */
00128 void *
00129 SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::encode(PESectionTableEntry_disk *disk) const
00130 {
00131     /* The file can hold up to eight characters of the name. The name is NUL-padded, not necessarily NUL-terminated. */
00132     if (p_name.size()>8) {
00133         fprintf(stderr, "warning: section name too long to store in PE file: \"%s\" (truncated)\n",
00134                 escapeString(p_name).c_str());
00135     }
00136     memset(disk->name, 0, sizeof(disk->name));
00137 
00138 #ifdef USE_ROSE
00139     // DQ (1/27/2010): std::min() does not appear to be handle different type of arguments for ROSE. Need to look into this later.
00140     // memcpy(disk->name, p_name.c_str(), std::min(sizeof(disk->name), (size_t)p_name.size()));
00141     memcpy(disk->name, p_name.c_str(), std::min( (size_t)(sizeof(disk->name)), (size_t)(p_name.size()) ));
00142 #else
00143     memcpy(disk->name, p_name.c_str(), std::min(sizeof(disk->name), p_name.size()));
00144 #endif
00145 
00146     host_to_le(p_virtual_size,     &(disk->virtual_size));
00147     host_to_le(p_rva,              &(disk->rva));
00148     host_to_le(p_physical_size,    &(disk->physical_size));
00149     host_to_le(p_physical_offset,  &(disk->physical_offset));
00150     host_to_le(p_coff_line_nums,   &(disk->coff_line_nums));
00151     host_to_le(p_n_relocs,         &(disk->n_relocs));
00152     host_to_le(p_n_coff_line_nums, &(disk->n_coff_line_nums));
00153     host_to_le(p_flags,            &(disk->flags));
00154 
00155     return disk;
00156 }

00158 /* Prints some debugging info */
00159 void
00160 SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::dump(FILE *f, const char *prefix, ssize_t idx) const
00161 {
00162     char p[4096];
00163     if (idx>=0) {
00164         sprintf(p, "%sPESectionTableEntry[%zd].", prefix, idx);
00165     } else {
00166         sprintf(p, "%sPESectionTableEntry.", prefix);
00167     }
00168 
00169     const int w = std::max(1, DUMP_FIELD_WIDTH-(int)strlen(p));
00170 
00171     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %" PRIu64 " bytes\n",            p, w, "virtual_size",     p_virtual_size);
00172     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08" PRIx64 "\n",              p, w, "rva",              p_rva);
00173     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %" PRIu64 " bytes\n",            p, w, "physical_size",    p_physical_size);
00174     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %" PRIu64 " file byte offset\n", p, w, "physical_offset",  p_physical_offset);
00175     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u byte offset\n",               p, w, "coff_line_nums",   p_coff_line_nums);
00176     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u\n",                           p, w, "n_relocs",         p_n_relocs);
00177     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u\n",                           p, w, "n_coff_line_nums", p_n_coff_line_nums);
00178     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08x\n",                       p, w, "flags",            p_flags);
00179 }

00181 /* Constructor */
00182 void
00183 SgAsmPESectionTable::ctor()
00184 {
00185     SgAsmPEFileHeader *fhdr = dynamic_cast<SgAsmPEFileHeader*>(get_header());
00186     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr!=NULL);
00187     fhdr->set_section_table(this);
00188 
00189     set_synthesized(true);
00190     set_name(new SgAsmBasicString("PE Section Table"));
00191     set_purpose(SP_HEADER);
00192 }
00193 
00194 /* Parser */
00195 SgAsmPESectionTable*
00196 SgAsmPESectionTable::parse()
00197 {
00198     SgAsmGenericSection::parse();
00199 
00200     SgAsmPEFileHeader *fhdr = dynamic_cast<SgAsmPEFileHeader*>(get_header());
00201     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr!=NULL);
00202 
00203     /* Parse section table and construct section objects, but do not parse the sections yet. */
00204     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList pending;
00205     const size_t entsize = sizeof(SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::PESectionTableEntry_disk);
00206     for (size_t i=0; i<fhdr->get_e_nsections(); i++) {
00207         SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::PESectionTableEntry_disk disk;
00208         if (entsize!=read_content_local(i * entsize, &disk, entsize, false))
00209             fprintf(stderr, "SgAsmPESectionTable::parse: warning: section table entry %zu at file offset 0x%08"PRIx64
00210                     " extends beyond end of defined section table.\n",
00211                     i, get_offset()+i*entsize);
00212         SgAsmPESectionTableEntry *entry = new SgAsmPESectionTableEntry(&disk);
00213 
00214         SgAsmPESection *section = NULL;
00215         if (entry->get_name() == ".idata") {
00216             section = new SgAsmPEImportSection(fhdr);
00217         } else {
00218             section = new SgAsmPESection(fhdr);
00219         }
00220         section->init_from_section_table(entry, i+1);
00221         pending.push_back(section);
00222     }
00223 
00224     /* Build the memory mapping like the real loader would do. This is the same code used by
00225      * SgAsmExecutableFileFormat::parseBinaryFormat() except we're doing it here early because we need it in the rest of the
00226      * PE parser. */
00227     ROSE_ASSERT(NULL==fhdr->get_loader_map());
00228     BinaryLoader *loader = BinaryLoader::lookup(fhdr); /*no need to clone; we're not changing any settings*/
00229     ROSE_ASSERT(loader!=NULL);
00230     MemoryMap *loader_map = new MemoryMap;
00231     loader->remap(loader_map, fhdr);
00232     fhdr->set_loader_map(loader_map);
00233 
00234     /* Parse each section after the loader map is created */
00235     for (size_t i=0; i<pending.size(); i++)
00236         pending[i]->parse();
00237 
00238     return this;
00239 }
00240 
00244 void
00245 SgAsmPESectionTable::add_section(SgAsmPESection *section)
00246 {
00247     ROSE_ASSERT(section!=NULL);
00248     ROSE_ASSERT(section->get_file()==get_file());
00249     ROSE_ASSERT(section->get_header()==get_header());
00250     ROSE_ASSERT(section->get_section_entry()==NULL);            /* must not be in the section table yet */
00251     
00252     SgAsmPEFileHeader *fhdr = dynamic_cast<SgAsmPEFileHeader*>(get_header());
00253     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr!=NULL);
00254     
00255     /* Assign an ID if there isn't one yet. */
00256     if (section->get_id()<0) {
00257         SgAsmGenericSectionList *seclist = fhdr->get_sections();;
00258         int max_id=0; /*assume zero is used so we start at one*/
00259         for (size_t i=0; i<seclist->get_sections().size(); i++) {
00260             SgAsmGenericSection *s = seclist->get_sections()[i];
00261 
00262                         max_id = std::max(max_id, s->get_id());
00263 
00264                 }
00265         section->set_id(max_id+1);
00266     }
00267     
00268     /* Create a new section table entry. */
00269     SgAsmPESectionTableEntry *entry = new SgAsmPESectionTableEntry;
00270     entry->update_from_section(section);
00271     section->set_section_entry(entry);
00272 }
00273 
00274 /* Pre-unparsing updates */
00275 bool
00276 SgAsmPESectionTable::reallocate()
00277 {
00278     bool reallocated = false;
00279     
00280     /* Resize based on section having largest ID */
00281     SgAsmPEFileHeader *fhdr = dynamic_cast<SgAsmPEFileHeader*>(get_header());
00282     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr != NULL);
00283     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList sections = fhdr->get_sections()->get_sections();
00284     int max_id = 0;
00285     for (size_t i=0; i<sections.size(); i++) {
00286 
00287         max_id = std::max(max_id, sections[i]->get_id());
00288 
00289         }
00290     
00291     size_t nsections = max_id; /*PE section IDs are 1-origin*/
00292     size_t need = nsections * sizeof(SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::PESectionTableEntry_disk);
00293     if (need < get_size()) {
00294         if (is_mapped()) {
00295             ROSE_ASSERT(get_mapped_size()==get_size());
00296             set_mapped_size(need);
00297         }
00298         set_size(need);
00299         reallocated = true;
00300     } else if (need > get_size()) {
00301         get_file()->shift_extend(this, 0, need-get_size(), SgAsmGenericFile::ADDRSP_ALL, SgAsmGenericFile::ELASTIC_HOLE);
00302         reallocated = true;
00303     }
00304 
00305     return reallocated;
00306 }
00307 
00308 /* Writes the section table back to disk. */
00309 void
00310 SgAsmPESectionTable::unparse(std::ostream &f) const
00311 {
00312     SgAsmPEFileHeader *fhdr = dynamic_cast<SgAsmPEFileHeader*>(get_header());
00313     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr != NULL);
00314     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList sections = fhdr->get_sections()->get_sections();
00315 
00316     for (size_t i = 0; i < sections.size(); i++) {
00317         if (sections[i]->get_id()>=0) {
00318             SgAsmPESection *section = isSgAsmPESection(sections[i]);
00319             ROSE_ASSERT(section!=NULL);
00320 
00321             /* Write the table entry */
00322             ROSE_ASSERT(section->get_id() > 0); /*ID's are 1-origin in PE*/
00323             size_t slot = section->get_id() - 1;
00324             SgAsmPESectionTableEntry *shdr = section->get_section_entry();
00325             SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::PESectionTableEntry_disk disk;
00326             shdr->encode(&disk);
00327             write(f, slot*sizeof(disk), sizeof disk, &disk);
00328         }
00329     }
00330 }

00333 void
00334 SgAsmPESectionTable::dump(FILE *f, const char *prefix, ssize_t idx) const
00335 {
00336     char p[4096];

00338         sprintf(p, "%sPESectionTable[%zd].", prefix, idx);
00339     } else {
00340         sprintf(p, "%sPESectionTable.", prefix);
00341     }
00342 
00343     SgAsmGenericSection::dump(f, p, -1);
00344 
00345     if (variantT() == V_SgAsmPESectionTable) //unless a base class
00346         hexdump(f, 0, std::string(p)+"data at ", p_data);
00347 }
